result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joseph F. Fitzpatrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Distribution to Minors, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Distribution to Minors], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Discharge - Regular

04:00 PM Defendant Joseph F. Fitzpatrick not in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pfeifer statement - defendant has complied - moves to dismiss - Granted
Review hearing on May 6, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

3:08 p.m. Defendant Joseph F. Fitzpatrick in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement - defendant's motion to reduce period of probation, s. 973.09(3)(a), references Dowdy case; finds period of probation cannot be reduced. Court references s. 973.09(3)(d) provides authority with conditions met; petition must by filed by the department. Court denies motion. 3:11 p.m. adj.
in Support of Motion to Modify Bond
for modification of bond

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
Defense Exhibit 1--original retained in Exhibit file drawer

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: DEJ

3:22 p.m. Defendant Joseph F. Fitzpatrick in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Schiek states agreement. Plea questionnaire filed. Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement and Defendant Exhibit 1 marked (letter). State moves to amend Count 1 to a violation of 961.41(3g)(e), a Misdemeanor and to amend Count 4 to a violation of 948.095(3)(a), a Class H Felony - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1, 4, 6 and 7.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1, 6 and 7. Court finds that a factual basis for plea exists on Count 4, accepts plea, defers entry of plea and accepts written Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement. Court receives Defendant's Exhibit 1. Schiek statement that victim rights legislation has been complied with. Schiek/Cirilli/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 3 years CC
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Conditional Jail - 60 days with Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before Friday, June 3, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
Jail credit - 1 day if revoked
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment application given. NADVI given.
Review date for DEJ will be obtained from JA.

2:42 pm. Defendant Joseph F. Fitzpatrick in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cirilli in receipt of information, waives reading, and enters not guilty pleas.  Cirilli statement to bond. Defendant may travel to Illinois September 1 through September 7, 2015.  All other conditions of bail continued. Adj. 2:43 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Arraignment at 08-03-2015 02:30 pm
